question: Does engagement of PD-1 on human monocytes by PD-L1 increase IL-10 production by the monocytes? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Triggering of PD-1 expressed on monocytes by PD-L1 expressed on various cell types induced IL-10 production and led to reversible CD4+ T cell dysfunction.
content.source_2: Cross-linking PD-1 on primary human monocytes failed to elevate IL-10; instead, ligation reduced IL-10 secretion and did not impair CD4+ T cell activation.
content.source_3: We describe a new function for PD-1 whereby microbial products inhibit T cell expansion and function by upregulating PD-1 levels and IL-10 production by monocytes after binding of PD-1 by PD-L1.
content.source_4: In longitudinal analyses of monocytes from antiretroviral-treated individuals, engagement of PD-1 predominantly induced IL-12 and left IL-10 unchanged, with no measurable effect on CD4+ T cell function.
